metadata.case_name: Department v. Karta of Poomulli Mana

facts.text: Respondent was the karta of Namboodri family known as Poomulli Mana till March 30, 1958.
Family owned large tracts of lands in Malabar District (part of Madras till Nov 1, 1956) and erstwhile Travancore-Cochin State.
New State of Kerala formed on November 1, 1956 under States Reorganization Act, 1956.
Travancore-Cochin Agricultural Income-tax Act, 1950 extended to Malabar District from April 1, 1957 by Kerala Act 8 of 1957.
In assessment year 1957-58, assessing authorities assessed Poomulli Mana as undivided family; order quashed by Kerala High Court.
On March 30, 1958, members of family entered into registered partition deed; family became divided; respondent ceased to be karta.
Authorities issued notices to respondent under S.17(2) and S.39 proposing to assess him as manager of HUF for 1957-58 and 1958-59.
Respondent challenged notices before Kerala High Court; Department's counsel stated assessment only as individual, not karta; High Court recorded assurance and disposed petition.
Despite assurance, Department issued notice under S.35 on February 9, 1960 to assess as karta for 1959-60; quashed by single judge on January 3, 1961 as against undertaking; affirmed in appeal.
Notice dated November 8, 1961 under S.35 to show cause why not taxed as karta for 1958-59; quashed by High Court on December 17, 1963.
S.29 of Kerala Agricultural Income-tax Act, 1950 amended by Act 12 of 1964, retrospective from April 1, 1958.
Department issued notice on June 1, 1964 under S.35 to assess as karta from November 1, 1956 to March 31, 1958; respondent moved High Court to quash.
Assessing authorities passed orders assessing respondent as karta; Division Bench quashed notice and assessment.
During pendency, Department issued notices Ex. P-1 (March 10, 1965) and P-3 under S.35 requiring return for family income for assessment year 1961-62, citing amendment.
Respondent replied citing partition and prior individual assessments from 1959-60 to 1964-65; moved High Court to quash notices (O.P. Nos. 2979/1965 and 1395/1966).
Kerala High Court (majority: Krishnamoorthy Iyer and Eradi, JJ.) allowed writ, quashed notices; Mathew, J. dissented.
Respondent and family members assessed as individuals from 1958-1964; assessments final, tax paid.

legal_issues.text: What is the true scope of s. 29 of the Kerala Agricultural Income-tax Act, 1950 as amended in 1964?

petitioner_arguments.text: In view of amendment of S.29 by Act 12 of 1964, permissible to reassess respondent as karta of family as no decision by ITO that family is divided, so deemed undivided.

respondent_arguments.text: Family treated as divided in earlier assessments; not open to assess as karta of non-existing family; partition accepted by Department.
In view of partition, cannot be assessed as karta; prior assessments as individuals.

court_reasoning.text: S.29 is machinery section, attracted only if family hitherto assessed as undivided or assessed for first time as HUF; neither condition met as family assessed as divided, partition recognized.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Family ceased to exist post-partition; cannot deem non-existing family as HUF.

court_reasoning.text: Prior High Court orders and assessments treated family as divided; Department conceded assessment as individual.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Question of division already decided in earlier years.

court_reasoning.text: S.29(1) presupposes existing family known to law, not creating or resurrecting divided family.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Deeming provision in S.29(3) applies only if conditions in S.29(1) satisfied.

court_reasoning.text: S.29 corresponds to S.25A of Income-tax Act 1922; object to provide machinery for tax on divided families, but limited scope.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Liability incurred when income earned; S.29 machinery only.

holdings.text: S.29 not applicable to family already treated as divided with final individual assessments; cannot assess as HUF post-partition.

precedents_cited.case_name: Additional Income-tax Officer Cuddapah v. A. Thimmayya
precedents_cited.relevance: Scope and object of S.25A Income-tax Act 1922, corresponding to S.29

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Agricultural Income-tax Act, 1950
statutes_cited.relevance: Governing assessment after partition of HUF; charging section; definition of person and HUF; notices and reassessment

statutes_cited.name: Indian Income-tax Act, 1922
statutes_cited.relevance: Analogous provisions to S.29; scheme of assessment on divided families

statutes_cited.name: Kerala Act 8 of 1957
statutes_cited.relevance: Extended Act to Malabar from April 1, 1957

outcome.summary: Supreme Court upheld Kerala High Court orders quashing notices under S.35 to assess respondent as karta of divided HUF, holding S.29 inapplicable as family not hitherto assessed as undivided nor being assessed for first time.

key_quotes.text: "Section 29 is only a machinery section... The deeming provision contained in s. 29(3) can have application only in cases where one or the other condition prescribed in s. 29(1) is satisfied and not otherwise."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on scope of S.29

key_quotes.text: "The family referred to in S. 29(1) is a family known to law and not a deemed family."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Limits deeming fiction to existing families

key_quotes.text: "Looking at the course of events, one cannot fail to notice with regret the persistence with which the Department was harassing the respondent."
key_quotes.speaker: court
